channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of dirt on the sidewalk, an ongoing issue, 10th July
item.description:
It seems like this is a permanent place to throw dirt, it needs to be urgently cleared and cleaned. It is requested PLEASE that the Council will place a warning notice there not to throw dirt and rubbish there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leabourne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees on Telegraph lane need clearing, 10th July
item.description:
In April 2023 I reported this problem to the Council and nothing was done. The trees behind my property are dead and need clearing. They are pulling away my fence panels and the back panel to my shed. I can't repair these until the dead trees have been cleared. They spread across my shed roof and, as they are dry, are a fire hazard in this weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Barham Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Upsetting flytipping Barnwell Rd planters, 10th July
item.description:
Hi there - this is someone taking real advantage here and we’d now like some pro-active action from Lambeth pls. Lambeth are great at removing stuff when we report (pls remove!) - but it just means that people think this corner is a free drop off point for junk. We hsve asked for posters - but could Lambeth possibly investigate its origin pls? We have every reason to believe it’s a landlord with property local to here. Could some surveillance be set up? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwell Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive plant Box hanging over balcony, 10th July
item.description:
I am flat 3 Marsh court. The tenant at 28 marsh court has a plant box hanging over his balcony. For health and safety reasons I would like for him to place the box inside his balcony for obvious health and safety reasons. He has been notified once before.
